title: Näytön pyöritys ei toimi
comment: Ilmeisesti tuoreimmassa päivityksessä lakkasi automaattinen näytön pyöritys toimimasta. Näyttö pysyy vaakatasossa, vaikka automaattinen kääntö on päällä. Pystyyn sen saa vain lukitsemalla sen pystyyn. Puhelimenani on Motorola Moto G LTE.

title: Connectbot for irrsi!
comment: I imagine not many will irssi from their phone,  but this variation makes doing so more pleasant.

title: Awesome
comment: after all these years still no better app on the market for irc and admin

title: ssh
comment: Very great Client. With hackers-keyboard it is a perfect combination. It should possible to export/import hosts like putty session manager. With Helium Backup it isn't possible, too.
JuiceSSH does it better.
Brilliant
Works great with my existing irc (irssi + screen) setup.

title: Dobra rzecz
comment: Gdy nie ma kompa w pobliżu i trzeba się szybko zalogować na vpsa to idealne.
nice
It simply works!

title: Great!
comment: The irssi specific additions are great.
Mkt bättre an alternativen!  Krashar inte for mig på Desire Z eller Nexus 5. Älskar att de fixat problem med hårdvaruttangentbord.  Confa lite så funkar saker bra:)

title: Problem on android 4.3 - does not enter commands after login.
comment: Workaround: use SYM to send any symbol first, then it starts working normally.
Can't live without it
no landscape view. removing app.

title: look great...
comment: Until you decide you want to use a hardware keyboard and realize the shift keys don't work in this piece of crap.

title: Does not listen to backspace
comment: This app sometimes doesn't listen to backspace, making it impossible to remove text. This happens mostly in vi, when you paste text somewhere, or when you have entered a command to be run on connect. Would be awesome with a fix.

title: Excellent on Sony Xperia tablet with hackers keyboard
comment: Only thought is an option to copy a pubkey directly to a host - either as a menu option or on host creation - would be nice (sort of emulation for ssh-copy-key / ssh-copy-id / cat [pubkey] | ssh [user]@[host] "cat >> [authorized_keys]" )

title: Good but could use a few improvements.
comment: It's really a good app but I wish that there was a way to save identities with passwords. And a autocomplete tab-key similar to JuiceSSH could be golden as well. The top-bar could be removed as well for more space.

title: No problems
comment: Fine shortcuts for often used keystrokes

title: Excellent
comment: If it was able to scroll up in your own comment history I would be even happier.

title: Way better than ConnectBot & on par with JuiceSSH & works w/ swipe/Swype
comment: The convenience features for irssi and screen are especially great but it also works well just for normal command-line access. The one thing it lacks that I wish it had is mosh support. JuiceSSH has mosh but doesn't work with the Android swipe keyboard or Swype. So if you use the swipe keyboard or Swype, you'll probably be happier with Irssi ConnectBot.

title: No way to enable text completion
comment: The only feature this is missing is the ability to turn on and back off auto-correct and text completion. Since I use this the most with Irssi in a screen session, being able to use SwiftKey to type would make this perfect.
no tab on gs. cant connect to key only ssh even with key loaded (bug)

title: Excellent
comment: Though a bit buggy. Also, have to press enter for startup scripts. Also annoyingly changes buffer on weechat when I disconnect.

title: Awesomeness!
comment: Thanks guys.. Love it!

title: I would love to rate this app higher
comment: I mean it supports full ANSI, telnet, and so many great things - except keyboards.  I mean, what use is a SSH/Telnet app if it doesn't even properly support keyboards?

title: Very Good Application
comment: The Application is very good, but didn't support multiwindows, so i can't open my office files with may irssi

title: Very good ssh
comment: Minor problems: - Hitting ESCape on the external keybooard opens the URL scan. - When a bluetooth keyboard is connected it rotates to landscape only from one side while my tablet cover allows the support for the opposite. It would be nice to allow which ever rotation the user likes.

title: Works well for irssi
comment: Love it for connecting to IRC with my spotty cell signal. I just wish that it had 'home' as part of the commands. Nothing more annoying then writing out a long pose to find out you did /ne in error.

title: Perfect but crashing lately on the S3
comment: erfect otherwise, but has started crashing in random situations. Using an S3

title: Good but really should be merged upstream.
comment: Good but really should be merged as options into the original connectbot. The changes are too minimal for a whole separate project and it would be nice to have the keystroke on gesture support as a generic configurable option, rather than being hard-coded to Irssi.
Nice ssh client, great for use with irssi.

title: Excellent
comment: Love the irssi additional features.  20130823: Another wish - ability to mark (hilight) some text on screen and copy it to clipboard. Filled wishes: obeys 360° screen rotation

title: Crashes in jellybean
comment: Amazing on my older devices but swiping down crashes in jellybean every time.
A solid piece of software.

title: Great
comment: Great and intuitive but suffers a bit because of Android's desing. Loses connection too often. I used to have putty touch ui and it is far more stable in Symbian than connect bot in Android.

title: Crashes often
comment: Nice, but keeps crashing with my new samsung galaxy s3mini. Annoying when I have to reconnect all the time.

title: Better then the original connectbot
comment: I use dvtm over ssh to allow me to access multiple terminals instead of just the one on most of my linux boxes. The original connectbot didnt support the hardware control key on my transformer prime, where as this one does natively! Instead of me having to press the screen each time (which was a huge pain), i can use the keyboard like i should have been able to all along. MY NEW SSH CLIENT!!

title: Needs fixing
comment: In the standard connectbot it resizes the screen when the keyboard opens. For me irssi connectbot no longer does this, it just moved the screen up so I can't see half of it any more.

title: Very  good
comment: but two things. - Would be very nice if the URLs in the url-scan feature could be editted before use! - Agent forwarding did not seem to always work.... unitl I figured how to change settings for a specific connection. For me it was not clear you need to long press a connection entry to be able to edit it...
Mahtava softa

title: Crashing all the time
comment: This was a good, the best, app for irssi. Unfortunately nowdays the software crashes all the time, changing windows or when writing a line. Also loses information copied on some other programs -> you have to copy text twice before you can paste it on IC. I hope this problem will be solved soon.
Second to none

title: The best.
comment: 265 color support would be great.

title: Useful app
comment: A must have app for linux guys. Highly recommended!

title: Much better than ConnectBot
comment: Tab auto complete works! I also like the smaller fonts. This is much more usable than the original Connectbot.

title: Works well with GNU Screen
comment: The extra keys in the popup menu are great. Instead of double-tapping to get CTRL and then hitting A to execute a Screen command in the vanilla ConnectBot, it has CTRL+A in the long-press menu. Also nice to have Tab for Tab-completion of long filenames instead of having to do a CTRL+i.

title: Just excellent
comment: Irssi Connectbot is crucial to any irssi / Android users.

title: Wish it had more features
comment: Not _that_much better than ConnectBot when it comes to using Irssi. I guess the swiping is nice.

title: It is okay
comment: It has a lot of catching up to do with iSSH but integration with irssi is pretty good. A little customization would be nice.

title: Very good except . .
comment: the uppercase numbers, as in !@#$%^ keys on the TF700T physical keyboard don't work.

title: Remove the top bar
comment: I dont like the large top bar. It takes up alot of screen area.  But its a awsome app.

title: irssi or die
comment: I am thankful that this exists.

title: Love it
comment: Easy way to use my existing irssi session especially combined with irssinotifier

title: Flip
comment: Please add flipping screen

comment: Even with screen and Urdu support.
crashes with tmux

title: Support physical keyboards

title: Crashes when irssi runs in tmux

title: Still sending private keys to Google?
comment: Loved this software, but just saw the comment about private keys still being sent to Google. Very bad. Can anyone confirm or deny this please?

title: Excellent quality (the best) program for IRC-nerds
comment: The first problem I've ever encountered with this app on the nexus 7 is that the connection drops randomly when the screen changes orientation. This is really annoying and it only happens on the nexus 7, my phone can't replicate it. Just get this for your ssh/irc-screen needs.

title: Battery drain if left open
comment: Functionality wise good app. Just don't leave connections running in background as it can cause massive battery drain (almost equivalent of having display always on).

title: Marvelous with hardware keyboard
comment: Used this for a long time on a Samsung moment and appreciated the enhancements.  It works great on my TF 101; I can use the ctrl key very naturally and operate bash and tmux.  I tried VX connectbot but it's keyboard shortcuts got in the way.
Nice

title: I love it
comment: This app is just about perfect for your ssh and telnet needs.  With the last update I sometimes get a band of random noise about 2cm wide in the upper half of the screen.  Also, with the newer phones/tablets without a physical scroll wheel, I havent found a way to use up- and down arrows, which would be very useful.

title: Love the App
comment: This is the Best SSH app around I could find though after upgrading from the Asus TF 201 to the Asus TF 700 the Ctrl Key do not work which makes programs like 'nano' and 'irssi' its self not work, a fix for this will result in five stars!

title: Nice!
comment: It's almost perfect, but there's on little thing I would change. In EEE Pad TF101, it would be really useful, if search key would work as metakey (alt/esc) instead of url scan.

title: Great
comment: I was waiting for fork. This one seems to be more up to date and well maintained.

title: Best app from play
comment: Cant live without this app    and it comes without ads  thats why i like it    swipe to change irssi window is ingenious
Hi, how do you use up and down arrow keys on nexus 7, gesture doesn't work.

title: Better than ConnectBot
comment: ConnectBot is considered to be the best SSH client, but this one is even better. Works great, except that there are issues with full screen mode in which text goes behind the keyboard, but I think ConnectBot has this same problem.

title: Better for Hardware Keyboard
comment: Works better for my ASUS transformer keyboard dock than ConnectBot.

title: Excellent app!
comment: Originally installed this for.irssi support only, but then discovered it works with mutt excellently! Thanks for the work on this app.

title: AWESOME!
comment: If you're an IRC nerd and want to be able to ssh into a box running irssi, this app is perfect!!  If you already have ConnectBot installed, this app might have conflicts, because it's the same thing with extra irssi support. Uninstall ConnectBot and everything works perfectly!

title: Still gives private keys to Google.
comment: Hi! I'm "Pricey from freenode". Despite the current "what's new", this app still sends your private keys to Google without your consent. This is bad.

title: asus tf700 dock problem
comment: Great app, but the ctrl/alt in the new tf700 transformer pad's dock don't seem to work the same way they do with the tf201. A fix would be much appreciated!

title: Useless with a physical keyboard
comment: I'm both really impressed and horribly appalled at this application. On2 the one hand, the features and the interface are excellent: it's quick and does it's job very well. However if you're using a physical keyboard, it's bordering on useless.  Since this app maps shift-0 .. shift-9 function keys, it is  impossible to get symbols like !@#$%^&* on the screen without having to jump through hoops (ie. onscreen symbol table). As a programmer, I easily use common symbols like !@# more than function keys and need them quite often.    How could such a huge error in design be made? Include a key mapping feature in this app to account for this inane design decision, or it's impractical with a keyboard. Get vx connect bot instead. It works.

title: Esc mapping
comment: Below: There's already an option to map the search key to ALT (meta) == esc. Awesome product :)

title: Prompt Updates Based On Feedback
comment: As I said before in my earlier review, this app is great. What's more, Iiro was prompt in updating it when I pointed out a potential security flaw (backing up private keys to potentially unencrypted servers), and that instantly earns piles of good will from me.  Great app. If you need an SSH client on Android, look no further.

title: Addicted
comment: Awesome client, Thanks :-)

title: Great app
comment: Would like better tmux integration, but that's wishlist stuff. The fact that this exists at all is fantastic.

title: bugsense. really?
comment: epic fail, man.  add a pay for version without the bug sense and other  tracking crap, and I'll buy it.  but don't track me, man. this is a secure connection app. tracking is not secure.

title: Buggy on Jellybean
comment: Yaxju Galaxy Nexus Jellybean, swipe gestures crash the app. Otherwise a great app.

title: Great app but...
comment: I can't use it with a smaller than stock lcd_density. Please add font size. You'll get the other 3 stars...

title: Perfect for your IRC shell

title: great!

title: Portrait only?
comment: Does not do landscape on my Galaxy Tab 10.1.  Otherwise an excellent app, but unusable for me due to forced portrait.

title: ... with an arrow diwn
comment: Excellent app. In ICS however, it now features a rather bulky titlebar that takes up quite a bit of space on my SGSII. Don't know if this can be fixed though..

title: Works great with bluetooth keyboard
comment: This is the only version of connectbot I have found where the modifier keys (ctrl, alt, etc.) work as expected using the Linksys BlueTooth keyboard for Android 3.0+. The only combination I have not gotten is shift+tab but I can live without that. All other functionality works great. Would like to see these patches applied to the "Tablet" version of connectbot that's available from their Google code page.

title: Great improvement
comment: Thank you very much, TAB, irssi, screen and vim are finally usable with the TF201 ICS! \o/

title: Promising, needs 3 options
comment: Please add these two options: 1. Save password for a SSH connection. 2. Export/Import of connections 3. Add "application password"  I think these 3 additions will make this app perfect :)

comment: This app makes connectbot useful on the Asus Transformer Prime by providing support for the dock so you can use all modifier keys as you would expect.

title: Transformer Prime TF-201

title: Poor keyboard behavior
comment: When I hit Ctrl-C, I'd like Ctrl-C to be sent to the remote terminal, not be interpreted as "hey, they wanted to copy/paste. I'll tell them that they need to click-and-drag, instead!"  ssh session drops whenever Android renews its DHCP lease, which means you *must* use 'screen', or you'll experienced random, destructive disconnects.  Sometimes screws up its term behavior. In the same session, for one reason or another, a once-working backspace key can become ^H characters on the terminal. Worse, at that point, Ctrl-D doesn't work, either, and even any shift-numeral (for any of !@#$%^&*() ) becomes ~, instead. Very, very frustrating.

title: Need F# key support.
comment: Need F# key support,  otherwise is very nice.

comment: Supports Honeycomb natively (rather than emulation like stock ConnectBot) but Ctrl+<letter> doesn't work.  Basically looks a little better at the cost of being fully unable to use half of the Linux console on the target system.  Make ctrl-keys work and will reinstall.  Using EEE Transformer with hardware keyboard.
